definitions.definition: material made by weaving or knitting cotton, wool, silk, etc.

examples.text: His bandages had been made from strips of cloth.
a jacket made from woollen cloth
She works in the cloth trade.
They used to export cotton cloth.

definitions.definition: a piece of cloth, often used for a special purpose, especially cleaning things or covering a table

examples.text: Wipe the surface with a damp cloth.
Place the dough in a bowl and cover with a clean cloth.
He gently cleaned her face with a wet cloth.
Wipe the table with a damp cloth.

definitions.definition: used to refer to Christian priests as a group
to do only what you have enough money to do and no more

examples.text: We wanted to buy a bigger house than this but it was a case of cutting our coat according to our cloth.

wordOrigin: Old English clāth, related to Dutch kleed and German Kleid, of unknown ultimate origin.
